original: gsum pa dang bzhi pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rang bzhin dag gis ni sems dben no //
analyzed: gsum pa dang bzhi pa kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i rang bzhin dag gis ni sems dben no //
translated: The third and fourth stages are the isolation of mind by means of the natures of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: lnga pas bden pa gnyis tha mi dad pa'i phyir mthar thug sems rnam par dben pa nyid do //
analyzed: lnga pas bden pa gnyis tha mi dad pa'i phyir mthar thug sems rnam par dben pa nyid do //

original: de'i nang du gtogs pas lus dang ngag rnam par dben pa yang @181a * //
analyzed: de'i nang du gtogs pas lus dang ngag rnam par dben pa yang @181a * //

analyzed: ngo // gang gi phyir lus mthar thug pa las longs spyod rdzogs pa dang sprul pa'i sku gnyis so //
translated: The two bodies, the body of enjoyment and the emanation body, are from the ultimate body.

original: ngag ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
analyzed: ngag ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ste /
translated: The body of enjoyment is speech,

analyzed: gsang sngags kyi theg par longs sku ni ngag gi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //

original: lus dang ngag 'di dag kyang sems kyi snang pa tsam ste /
analyzed: lus dang ngag 'di dag kyang sems kyi snang pa tsam ste /

original: sems kyang bde ba chen po'i bdag nyid can mngon par shes pa dang stobs dang ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi rang bzhin kun rdzob kyang yin la /

translated: And mind is the nature of great bliss, the nature of relative truth, which is the nature of qualities such as the superknowledges, powers, and unique qualities of a buddha.

original: rang bzhin med pas don dam pa yang yin te zung du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pas don dam pa yang yin te zung du 'jug pa'o //
translated: And it is ultimate truth, because it is devoid of intrinsic nature.üîΩThis is the union.

original: 'di nyid sgrub pa po dbang po rab kyis bsgom pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid sgrub pa po dbang po rab kyis bsgom pa yin no //
translated: This is the meditation of the practitioner of highest acumen.

original: chung du ni rim pa dang pos ji lta bar lha'i skur bsgom pa'i bdag nyid rim gyis sam /
analyzed: chung du ni rim pa dang pos ji lta bar lha'i skur bsgom pa'i bdag nyid rim gyis sam /
translated: The lesser is the yoga of the great seal, which is the yoga of meditating on the body of a deity, as explained in the first stage, and the yoga of entering and rising from the clear light either gradually or instantaneously.

original: cig car du 'od gsal du rab tu 'jug cing ldang ba dang / rdo rje'i bzlas pa dang chung du'i chung dus ngag gi bzlas pa yang goms par bya'o //
analyzed: cig car du 'od gsal du rab tu 'jug cing ldang ba dang / rdo rje'i bzlas pa dang chung du'i chung dus ngag gi bzlas pa yang goms par bya'o //
translated: One should also cultivate vajra repetition and verbal repetition, which are lesser and lesser.

original: 'di gnyis ka'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa'i rdo rje'i bzlas pa ni rim pa gnyis pas rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ka'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa'i rdo rje'i bzlas pa ni rim pa gnyis pas rgyas par bstan to //
translated: Vajra repetition taught in terms of these two is extensively taught in the second stage.

original: blo gros 'bring gis ni skad cig ye shes rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor rdzogs pa zhes brjod do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩskad cig gis sgyu ma'i rang bzhin lha'i skur bshad pa'i bdag nyid rim mam /
analyzed: blo gros 'bring gis ni skad cig ye shes rdzogs pa'i rnal 'byor rdzogs pa zhes brjod do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // skad cig gis sgyu ma'i rang bzhin lha'i skur bshad pa'i bdag nyid rim mam /
translated: This is because it is said that the yoga of perfecting instantaneous gnosis is expressed as the yoga of perfecting the middling.

original: cig car du 'od gsal du 'jug cing ldang ba'o //
analyzed: cig car du 'od gsal du 'jug cing ldang ba'o //
translated: The yoga of perfecting the lesser is the yoga of entering and rising from the clear light either gradually or instantaneously, which is the yoga of meditating on the body of a deity, as explained in the first stage, and the yoga of entering and rising from the clear light either gradually or instantaneously.üîΩThe yoga of perfecting the great is the yoga of entering and rising from the clear light either gradually or instantaneously, which is the yoga of meditating on the body of a deity, as explained in the first stage, and the yoga of entering and rising from the clear light either gradually or instantaneously.

original: de ni dang por bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i ming can kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku gnyis pa gsum pa bsgom pa'i phyir 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dang por bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i ming can kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku gnyis pa gsum pa bsgom pa'i phyir 'jug pa yin no //
translated: It is the entry into the cultivation of the second enjoyment body of conventional truth, which is called the first self consecration.

original: de'i rjes su kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang tha mi dad par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su kun rdzob kyi bden pa dang tha mi dad par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: After that, one should cultivate the non-duality of conventional truth.

original: 'on kyang de kho na nyid bsgom pa kho nas mi nus pas tha dad ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i rang bzhin med par rab tu 'jug pa dang / bden pa gnyis tha dad pa'i tshul gyis ldang ba'i phyir slob pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de kho na nyid bsgom pa kho nas mi nus pas tha dad ltar rnam par gzhag pa'i rang bzhin med par rab tu 'jug pa dang / bden pa gnyis tha dad pa'i tshul gyis ldang ba'i phyir slob pa'o //
translated: However, since one is unable to do so by the cultivation of reality alone, one is a learner because one enters into the absence of intrinsic reality as if it were different, and one arises by the method of the difference of the two truths.

original: kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid rang bzhin med pa ni don dam pa ste rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag par 'od gsal du brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi ngo bo nyid rang bzhin med pa ni don dam pa ste rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag par 'od gsal du brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: The ultimate is the absence of intrinsic reality of the nature of the conventional, which is called clear light, naturally pure.

original: de tha dad par yod pa ma yin pas tha mi dad par bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de tha dad par yod pa ma yin pas tha mi dad par bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Since it does not exist as different, one should cultivate it as non-dual.

original: 'on kyang de kho na nyid bsgom pa kho nas @181b bsgrib pa glo bur pa'i tshogs ma lus pa zad par 'gyur bas 'od gsal gyi cha 'bad par bsgom par bya bar shes nas rim pa bzhi pa dang rim pa dang po la slob pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang de kho na nyid bsgom pa kho nas @181b bsgrib pa glo bur pa'i tshogs ma lus pa zad par 'gyur bas 'od gsal gyi cha 'bad par bsgom par bya bar shes nas rim pa bzhi pa dang rim pa dang po la slob pa'o //
translated: However, since the entire collection of adventitious obscurations is exhausted by meditating on reality alone, one should understand that one should meditate on the aspect of clear light with effort.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dbang po rab kyis lha rnams bsgom pa dang / rab tu 'jug cing ldang ba dang / bzlas pa bzhag nas stong pa nyid kyi cha la 'bad de bsgoms pas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dbang po rab kyis lha rnams bsgom pa dang / rab tu 'jug cing ldang ba dang / bzlas pa bzhag nas stong pa nyid kyi cha la 'bad de bsgoms pas /
translated: Therefore, those of highest faculties, having set aside the meditation on the deities, entering and rising, and mantra repetition, should meditate with effort on the aspect of emptiness.

original: cig car skad cig rdzogs pa lha'i sku zung du 'jug pa rgyun ma chad par bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: cig car skad cig rdzogs pa lha'i sku zung du 'jug pa rgyun ma chad par bsgom pa'o //
translated: Thus, one should meditate on the uninterrupted union of the deity‚Äôs form, which is completed in an instant.

original: de ltar 'di rnams gang zag tha dad kyi rim pa lnga yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'di rnams gang zag tha dad kyi rim pa lnga yin no //
translated: Thus, these are the five stages of different individuals.

original: kha cig ni gang zag gcig kho na dang por chung du yin pas bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas 'od gsal la rab tu 'jug cing ldang ba dang / bzlas pa'i rim pa dang po gnyis kyis goms par byas nas de'i blo gros 'bring du gyur te skad cig gis lha'i skur 'char ba de rim pa gsum pa dang bzhi pas rab tu 'jug cing ldang ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni gang zag gcig kho na dang por chung du yin pas bskyed pa'i rim pa bsgom pa sngon du 'gro bas 'od gsal la rab tu 'jug cing ldang ba dang / bzlas pa'i rim pa dang po gnyis kyis goms par byas nas de'i blo gros 'bring du gyur te skad cig gis lha'i skur 'char ba de rim pa gsum pa dang bzhi pas rab tu 'jug cing ldang ba'o //
translated: Some say that one person first meditates on the creation stage, which is small, and then enters and arises from clear light, and that after becoming accustomed to the first two stages of repetition, his mind becomes medium, and he enters and arises from the third and fourth stages, which are the arising of the deity's form in an instant.

original: de goms rab tu gyur pa las zung du 'jug pa lha'i skur ldang ba nyid rim pa lnga pas so zhes pa ni rnam par gzhag pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de goms rab tu gyur pa las zung du 'jug pa lha'i skur ldang ba nyid rim pa lnga pas so zhes pa ni rnam par gzhag pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: And after becoming very accustomed to that, he arises in the deity's form of union, which is the fifth stage. This is the second presentation.

original: gnyis ka la yang zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa gsang sngags kyi theg par sku bzhi'i bdag nyid du bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka la yang zung du 'jug pa'i bdag nyid kyi bcom ldan 'das rdo rje 'dzin pa gsang sngags kyi theg par sku bzhi'i bdag nyid du bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: In both cases, one should establish the BhagavƒÅn Vajradhara, who is of the nature of union, as having the nature of the four bodies in the vehicle of mantra.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de la phyag 'tshal te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de la phyag 'tshal te /
translated: Therefore, I pay homage to him.

original: de la khams gsum pa'i spyod pa las grol zhes pa ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sems can rnams ni khams gsum pa ste /
analyzed: de la khams gsum pa'i spyod pa las grol zhes pa ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i sems can rnams ni khams gsum pa ste /
translated: The phrase freed from the activities of the three realms means that the beings of the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm are the three realms.

original: de dag gi spyod pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par sgro btags shing rab tu 'jug pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag gi spyod pa ni gzung ba dang 'dzin par sgro btags shing rab tu 'jug pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Their activities are the superimposition of subject and object, engagement, and so forth.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum gyi khongs su bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum gyi khongs su bsdu ba'o //
translated: They are included within the three afflictions.

original: de las grol ba ni rten yongs su gyur pas rnam par byang ba mtshan ma med pa chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: de las grol ba ni rten yongs su gyur pas rnam par byang ba mtshan ma med pa chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Liberation from them is the transformation of the basis, which is the purified, signless dharmakƒÅya.

original: mkha' dang mnyam gyur ni 'dra bar rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: mkha' dang mnyam gyur ni 'dra bar rtogs pa ste /
translated: Having become equal to space means that it is realized to be similar to space.

original: 'dus ma byas pa dang rtag pa dang 'gyur ba med pa dang dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa dang bral ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa dang / ro gcig pa nyid la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa dang rtag pa dang 'gyur ba med pa dang dbyibs dang kha dog la sogs pa dang bral ba dang / rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa dang / ro gcig pa nyid la sogs pa dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: It is similar to space in that it is unconditioned, permanent, unchanging, free from shape, color, and so forth, naturally pure, and of one taste.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dus byas pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnams kyi ngo bo ni don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'o //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dus byas pa kun rdzob kyi bden pa rnams kyi ngo bo ni don dam pa rang bzhin med pa'o //
translated: The nature of all things, such as the aggregates, which are dependently arisen, conditioned, and conventional truths, is ultimate, essencelessness.

original: de bas na 'di rtag tu kun la khyab pa nyid du bstan to /
analyzed: de bas na 'di rtag tu kun la khyab pa nyid du bstan to /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that this is always all-pervading.

original: @182a * // dag cing ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: @182a * // dag cing ni nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Pure means free from the afflictive obstructions.

original: zhi ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Peaceful means free from the obstructions to omniscience.

original: dben pa ni de gnyi ga'i bag la nyal bcom pa'o //
analyzed: dben pa ni de gnyi ga'i bag la nyal bcom pa'o //
translated: Solitary means the destruction of the latent predispositions for both of those.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad zad pa'i rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs kyi mthar thug pa'i phyir mchog tu dge ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad zad pa'i rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs kyi mthar thug pa'i phyir mchog tu dge ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Thus, it is the nature of supreme virtue because it is the culmination of the mass of good qualities such as purification, etc., which is the exhaustion of all resistant tendencies such as the afflictions, etc.

original: de ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa las rtogs pa 'di bla na med par bstan to //
analyzed: de ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa'i rtogs pa las rtogs pa 'di bla na med par bstan to //
translated: This is taught to be the unexcelled realization among the realizations of the ≈õrƒÅvakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor pa nyid yul te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnal 'byor pa nyid yul te /
translated: Therefore, only the Yogis,

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kho na'o//
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kho na'o//
translated: the Perfectly Awakened Ones, are the object.

original: ji ltar nas bcu'i dbang phyug rnams kyi yul ma yin zhe na gsungs pa rtogs dka' ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nas bcu'i dbang phyug rnams kyi yul ma yin zhe na gsungs pa rtogs dka' ste /
translated: How is it difficult to understand that it is not the object of the Lords of the Ten Stages?

original: rnam pa thams cad du mngon du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du mngon du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not manifest in any way.

original: brtag par dka' ba ni bag la nyal ba dang bcas pa'i sgom pa lhun gyis grub pa'i yang yul ma yin no //
analyzed: brtag par dka' ba ni bag la nyal ba dang bcas pa'i sgom pa lhun gyis grub pa'i yang yul ma yin no //
translated: It is not the object of the spontaneously born meditation with latent impressions.

original: brtag par dka' ba'i rang bzhin zhes bstod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtag par dka' ba'i rang bzhin zhes bstod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is praised as having the nature of the difficult to fathom.

original: bdag gzhan rab phan zhes pa ni chos kyi sku nyid do //
analyzed: bdag gzhan rab phan zhes pa ni chos kyi sku nyid do //
translated: The nature of the Dharma Body is the benefit of self and other.

original: dben pa las ni tha mi dad //
analyzed: dben pa las ni tha mi dad //
translated: It is not different from seclusion.

original: dben pa gang phyir 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: dben pa gang phyir 'dod pa yin //
translated: Seclusion is desired because of that.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir longs sku'i rang bzhin dang gzhan gyi bla na med pa chos kyi bdud rtsi'i ro la dga' bas long spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir longs sku'i rang bzhin dang gzhan gyi bla na med pa chos kyi bdud rtsi'i ro la dga' bas long spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is the nature of the Enjoyment Body, and because of delighting in the taste of the nectar of the unsurpassed Dharma for others.

original: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa chen po'i rten gyur zhes kyang bstod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la phan pa phun sum tshogs pa chen po'i rten gyur zhes kyang bstod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also praised as the support for the great perfection of benefit for self and other.

original: khyab cing de nyid de kho na bzhin du sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: khyab cing de nyid de kho na bzhin du sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo ste /
translated: It is the nature of the emanation body, which is all-pervading and just that suchness.

original: mthar thug pa med par khams gsum gyi sems can re re la sprul pa'i skus khyab pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa med par khams gsum gyi sems can re re la sprul pa'i skus khyab pa'o //
translated: It is the emanation body pervading each sentient being of the three realms without end.

original: phrin las khyab pa nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: phrin las khyab pa nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Because of the pervasiveness of activity,

original: sangs rgyas khyab pa nyid du brjod //
analyzed: sangs rgyas khyab pa nyid du brjod //
translated: the Buddha is said to be all-pervading.

original: ces mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las gsungs so //
analyzed: ces mngon par rtogs pa'i rgyan las gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in the Ornament of Clear Realization.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni yod med dang / gzung 'dzin dang rtag chang dang / tha dad pa dang / gcig la sogs pa sgro btags pa'i bye brag ni mtshan ma ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni yod med dang / gzung 'dzin dang rtag chang dang / tha dad pa dang / gcig la sogs pa sgro btags pa'i bye brag ni mtshan ma ste /
translated: Signlessness is the freedom from the various superimpositions of existence and nonexistence, subject and object, permanence and annihilation, difference and identity, and so forth.

original: de dang bral ba rang bzhin med cing spros pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de dang bral ba rang bzhin med cing spros pa dang bral ba'o //

analyzed: rim pa 'dir brdar gyur gyi sngags ni gtsor bstan pa ste /
translated: In this stage, the mantra of the symbol is taught as the principal one.

original: ngag g-yem yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngag g-yem yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is the mantra of the speech.

original: 'di ltar spyod bsdus las /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyod bsdus las /
translated: Thus the Compendium of Practice says:

original: lus ngag dben gyi mthar thug ni rdo rje'i bzlas pa tsam yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: lus ngag dben gyi mthar thug ni rdo rje'i bzlas pa tsam yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: The ultimate of the isolation of body and speech is the complete knowledge of just the vajra repetition.

original: de la lha'i rnam pa med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la lha'i rnam pa med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: There is no form of the deity there.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs rdo rje zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said, ‚Äúvajra speech‚Äù and so on.

original: gsung nyid rdo rje stong pa nyid de gsung gi rdo rje rang dbang du byas @190b la byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin du rtogs pas gsung gi rdo rje bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gsung nyid rdo rje stong pa nyid de gsung gi rdo rje rang dbang du byas @190b la byang chub sems kyi rang bzhin du rtogs pas gsung gi rdo rje bsgrub pa'o //
translated: Speech itself is the emptiness, the vajra. Having made the vajra speech one‚Äôs own, one realizes it as the nature of bodhicitta, and thus one accomplishes the vajra speech.

original: sems tsam la ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa las te nges par sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa las te nges par sbyar ro //
translated: One should apply this to the stage of self-consecration in the mind-only stage.

original: de nas bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa dang 'brel bar bstan to //
analyzed: de nas bdag byin gyis brlab pa'i rim pa dang 'brel bar bstan to //
translated: Then, having been taught in connection with the stage of self-consecration,

original: sngags kyi rlom pa ni ngag tu bzlas pa la zhen pas so //
analyzed: sngags kyi rlom pa ni ngag tu bzlas pa la zhen pas so //
translated: one should not be conceited about mantra, because one is attached to verbal repetition.

original: gzung bar bya zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa nas zung 'jug gi byang chub sems kyi gdams ngag gi rjes su gsang bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzung bar bya zhes pa ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa nas zung 'jug gi byang chub sems kyi gdams ngag gi rjes su gsang bar bya ste /
translated: One should keep it secret, because the instruction of the bodhicitta of union should be kept secret from the stage of vajra repetition onward.

original: ji ltar slob pas byang chub sems de la yod pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa dang sgrub par nus pa'i nges par shin tu dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar slob pas byang chub sems de la yod pa dang / yon tan dang ldan pa dang sgrub par nus pa'i nges par shin tu dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: How does one train? By means of the three kinds of conviction: conviction that the spirit of enlightenment exists, conviction that one has the qualities necessary to achieve it, and conviction that one is able to achieve it.

original: gang las de rgyun mi 'chad par yun ring por dad pa dang bcas pas bsgoms shing grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang las de rgyun mi 'chad par yun ring por dad pa dang bcas pas bsgoms shing grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And from that, one meditates with faith for a long time without interruption, and becomes liberated.

original: de ltar goms par mi byed na yang ri dbang rtse la sogs pa ste grol bar 'gyur zhes pa ni thar par 'os pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ltar goms par mi byed na yang ri dbang rtse la sogs pa ste grol bar 'gyur zhes pa ni thar par 'os pa nyid de /
translated: Even if one does not practice in this way, one is fit to be liberated, by being at the peak of existence, etc.

original: thar pa'i rgyu byang chub sems brtan par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa'i rgyu byang chub sems brtan par gzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one has taken up the spirit of enlightenment, which is the cause of liberation.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i dgongs 'grel lo //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pa'i dgongs 'grel lo //
translated: This is the commentary on the chapter on vajra repetition, the third chapter of the Illuminating Lamp, a commentary on the glorious Guhyasamaja Tantra.

original: 'dir rtogs par dka' ba'i thugs dang ldan pa 'phags pa chen po'i mchog gis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir rtogs par dka' ba'i thugs dang ldan pa 'phags pa chen po'i mchog gis gsungs so //
translated: Here, the great noble ones, who have minds difficult to fathom, have spoken.

original: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba yis //
analyzed: ye shes gsum gyi dbye ba yis //
translated: By means of the division of the three intuitions,

original: sems tsam la ni nges par sbyar //
analyzed: sems tsam la ni nges par sbyar //
translated: one should definitely apply oneself to mind only.

original: zhes bshad par 'dod pas de'i thugs kyi sras 'phags pa sh'akya bshes gnyen gyis rim pas bsgrub par bya ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bshad par 'dod pas de'i thugs kyi sras 'phags pa sh'akya bshes gnyen gyis rim pas bsgrub par bya ba'i rdo rje sems dpa' la phyag bya ste /
translated: Thus, in order to explain this, the spiritual son of his mind, the noble Sakyamitra, having paid homage to the Vajrasattva who is to be accomplished in stages,

original: khyod la phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyod la phyag 'tshal zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: says, Homage to you! and so forth.

original: phyag 'tshal ba bzhi rim pa bzhin du zung du 'jug pa'i bcom ldan 'das la ste /
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba bzhi rim pa bzhin du zung du 'jug pa'i bcom ldan 'das la ste /
translated: The four kinds of homage are to the Bhagavat of the stage of union,

original: stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po'i rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa dang shin tu stong pa dang / stong pa chen po'i rang bzhin gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: in terms of his nature as emptiness, utter emptiness, and great emptiness.

original: phyag 'tshal ba lan gnyis su brjod pa ni stong pa nyid la khyab par shin du dang par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba lan gnyis su brjod pa ni stong pa nyid la khyab par shin du dang par gyur pa'o //
translated: The repetition of the homage is due to his being extremely devoted to emptiness.

original: rgyu tha dad pa khyod la bstod nas rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin dang mnyam pas rang gi rgyud kyi rang bzhin khyed la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa khyod la bstod nas rdo rje 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin dang mnyam pas rang gi rgyud kyi rang bzhin khyed la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Having praised you, who are of different causes, I pay homage to you, whose nature is the same as that of the Vajra Holder.

original: gang gi phyir phyag 'tshal ba ni dgyes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyag 'tshal ba ni dgyes pa'i phyir te /
translated: For what reason is there homage? It is for the sake of delight.

original: de yang gzhan don du gnyer ba'i bcom ldan 'das la phyag byed pa po rang gi rgyud las byung ba'i 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / rgyu'i gnas skabs su rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por yongs su dgos nas mos pa bstan pas phyag bya ba ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: de yang gzhan don du gnyer ba'i bcom ldan 'das la phyag byed pa po rang gi rgyud las byung ba'i 'bras bu rdo rje 'dzin pa dang / rgyu'i gnas skabs su rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying por yongs su dgos nas mos pa bstan pas phyag bya ba ni mchog yin no //
translated: The homage is supreme because it is made by one who is devoted to the state of being thoroughly purified.

original: @191a * // phyag 'tshal ba yang phyag bya bar 'os pa la yid tshim pas mchog tu gyur pas de nyid bstod pa'i ngag gi rgyud yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @191a * // phyag 'tshal ba yang phyag bya bar 'os pa la yid tshim pas mchog tu gyur pas de nyid bstod pa'i ngag gi rgyud yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, homage is supreme because it is the most pleasing thing for one who is worthy of homage, and it is the cause of the continuity of praise.

original: de ltar rang la phyag byas pa gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar rang la phyag byas pa gang la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, the homage is to the one who is praised, and so on.

original: don dam par dbye ba thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par dbye ba thams cad med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the ultimate sense, there is no division of any kind.

original: kun rdzob tu ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the relative sense, it is as stated in the verse beginning with the words, How is it that...

original: rang gi ye shes zung du 'jug pa tha mi dad par rang gis rig pa ni phyag yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang gi ye shes zung du 'jug pa tha mi dad par rang gis rig pa ni phyag yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The homage is the self-awareness of one's own gnosis, which is the non-differentiation of the union. This is the meaning of the statement, The homage is to the one who is praised.

original: de yang so so'i gnas skabs su lhag par mos pa dang / lam gyi gnas skabs su rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis rig la rnam pa thams cad du ni ma yin no zhes bshad do ;
analyzed: de yang so so'i gnas skabs su lhag par mos pa dang / lam gyi gnas skabs su rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis rig la rnam pa thams cad du ni ma yin no zhes bshad do ;
translated: Moreover, it is said that in the individual stages, one has faith in the special, and in the path stage, one knows some aspects, but not all aspects.

original: /'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i kun mkhyen ni rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: /'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i kun mkhyen ni rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pa'o //
translated: However, the Omniscience, etc. The Omniscience is the realization of the Thatness of all things in all aspects.

original: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ni rtag tu yod pas ji ltar mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis yongs su dag pa ni rtag tu yod pas ji ltar mi dmigs she na /
translated: How is the intrinsically pure not perceived, since it always exists?

original: glo bur gyi ma rig pa'i mun pas khebs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glo bur gyi ma rig pa'i mun pas khebs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it is covered by the darkness of adventitious nescience.

original: mun pa de spang ba'i rnam pa ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas gsal ba'i rim pas mar me bzhin du snang bar byed pa'i ye shes stong pa nyid bzhi dang tha mi dad par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mun pa de spang ba'i rnam pa ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas gsal ba'i rim pas mar me bzhin du snang bar byed pa'i ye shes stong pa nyid bzhi dang tha mi dad par rtogs pa'o //
translated: The aspect of the abandonment of that darkness is the wisdom which illuminates the four emptinesses, like a lamp, through the stages of the Radiant, etc.

original: de bas na gsal ba'i rim pa dang rtogs pa'i rim pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na gsal ba'i rim pa dang rtogs pa'i rim pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the stages of illumination and the stages of realization should be taught.

original: stong nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The emptiness, etc.

original: gzung bar brtags pa 'ga' zhig dang bral bas stong pa ste /
analyzed: gzung bar brtags pa 'ga' zhig dang bral bas stong pa ste /
translated: It is empty because it is free from some of the imagined objects of apprehension.

original: dga' ba dang snang ba'i bdag nyid can no //üîΩgzung bar brtags pa ma lus pa dang 'dzin par brtag pa 'ga' zhig spangs pa shin tu stong pa de mchog tu dga' ba dang snang ba mched pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: dga' ba dang snang ba'i bdag nyid can no // gzung bar brtags pa ma lus pa dang 'dzin par brtag pa 'ga' zhig spangs pa shin tu stong pa de mchog tu dga' ba dang snang ba mched pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is the nature of joy and the increase of light.üîΩIt is the supreme joy and the nature of the increase of light.

original: 'dzin par brtags pa ma lus pa dang bral bas stong pa nyid chen po ste /
analyzed: 'dzin par brtags pa ma lus pa dang bral bas stong pa nyid chen po ste /
translated: It is the great emptiness, which is empty because it is free from all the imagined objects of apprehension and some of the imagined objects of apprehension.

original: dga' bral dang snang ba thob pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: dga' bral dang snang ba thob pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment of the separation of joy and the attainment of light.

original: de ltar bshad pas gzung 'dzin dang bral ba bde ba'i sems don dam par yod pa sgro btags pa dang ma bral bas /
analyzed: de ltar bshad pas gzung 'dzin dang bral ba bde ba'i sems don dam par yod pa sgro btags pa dang ma bral bas /
translated: Thus, by this explanation, the mind of bliss, which is free from the subject-object dichotomy, is not free from the superimposition of ultimate existence,

original: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang ro gcig pa'i kun rdzob lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa dang ro gcig pa'i kun rdzob lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: and so it is the nature of the relative coemergent joy, which is of one taste with all phenomena that lack intrinsic existence.

original: de lta bu'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa des dga' ba la sogs pas bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i stong pa nyid la sogs pa des dga' ba la sogs pas bde blag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: In order to easily realize such emptiness, etc. , by means of the joys, etc. , I will explain.

original: 'dir stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni skad cig gcig la mthong lam gyi bdag nyid rab tu dga' ba'i sa'i rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba rtogs @191b pa dang tha mi dad pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir stong pa nyid la sogs pa ni skad cig gcig la mthong lam gyi bdag nyid rab tu dga' ba'i sa'i rang bzhin lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba rtogs @191b pa dang tha mi dad pa ste /
translated: Here, emptiness, etc. , is the innate joy, which is of the nature of the stage of the Joyous, the essence of the path of insight, and is not different from the realization.

original: ltos pa tha dad pas tha dad pa ltar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ltos pa tha dad pas tha dad pa ltar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is posited as different by the difference of dependence.

original: ji ltar skad cig gcig gis bden pa mthong ba la skad cig bcu drug bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar skad cig gcig gis bden pa mthong ba la skad cig bcu drug bzhin no //
translated: Just as the seeing of the truth in one instant is like the sixteen instants.

original: de ltar 'dir 'di ni stong pa nyid bzhi dang ro gcig pa'i snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin sgyu ma'i skur /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir 'di ni stong pa nyid bzhi dang ro gcig pa'i snying rje chen po'i rang bzhin sgyu ma'i skur /
translated: Thus, here, this is the illusory body, which is of the nature of great compassion, one taste with the four emptinesses,

original: snang ba zung du 'jug pa'i bde ba chen po 'od gsal gyi mthar thug sngon du lhag par mos te /
analyzed: snang ba zung du 'jug pa'i bde ba chen po 'od gsal gyi mthar thug sngon du lhag par mos te /
translated: the great bliss of the union of appearance, the culmination of clear light, preceded by the special resolve.

original: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i 'bras bu mthong ba'i lam gyi bdag nyid can no //
translated: It is the result of meditation, having the nature of the path of insight.

original: de ltar mthong ba 'di'i gnas skabs phyi ma de dang der bsgoms pas sa bcu rgyun gyi tha mar sgro btags pa thams cad kyi bag chags zad pa'i mthar 'od gsal gyi rang bzhin 'byung ngo zhes bshad de shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar mthong ba 'di'i gnas skabs phyi ma de dang der bsgoms pas sa bcu rgyun gyi tha mar sgro btags pa thams cad kyi bag chags zad pa'i mthar 'od gsal gyi rang bzhin 'byung ngo zhes bshad de shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: This is explained as wisdom.

original: mthong lam nas bag chags kyi phyogs spangs pas /
analyzed: mthong lam nas bag chags kyi phyogs spangs pas /
translated: From the path of seeing, by means of abandoning the side of habitual tendencies,

original: khyad par du 'gyur ba'i ye shes ni shes rab ste snang ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'gyur ba'i ye shes ni shes rab ste snang ba'o //
translated: the wisdom that becomes special is wisdom, which is appearance.

original: rtogs pa phyi ma'i rgyu yin pas thabs te snang ba mched pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa phyi ma'i rgyu yin pas thabs te snang ba mched pa'o //
translated: Since it is the cause of subsequent realization, it is method, which is the increase of appearance.

original: de gnyis tha mi dad pa snang ba thob pa ste rgyu'o //
analyzed: de gnyis tha mi dad pa snang ba thob pa ste rgyu'o //
translated: Those two are not different, which is the attainment of appearance, which is the cause.

original: de nas de dang ro gcig pa'i 'bras bu ni 'od gsal te /
analyzed: de nas de dang ro gcig pa'i 'bras bu ni 'od gsal te /
translated: Then, the result that is of one taste with that is clear light,

original: rnam rtog gi mun pa thams cad ma lus par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam rtog gi mun pa thams cad ma lus par spangs pa'o //
translated: which is the complete abandonment of all the darkness of conceptuality.

original: de ltar rgya'i rim pas rnam par dag pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin de las stong pa bzhi dang / rang bzhin gcig pa rnam pa gsum gyi bdag nyid bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin stobs dang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de ltar rgya'i rim pas rnam par dag pa bar chad med pa'i lam gyi rang bzhin de las stong pa bzhi dang / rang bzhin gcig pa rnam pa gsum gyi bdag nyid bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin stobs dang mngon par shes pa la sogs pa rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa /
translated: Thus, in stages, from that nature of the uninterrupted path of complete purification, the four empty states and the three aspects of the single nature arise, and the nature of great bliss endowed with all aspects, such as the powers and superknowledges,

original: mtshan dang dpe byad kyis gsal ba longs sku'i rang bzhin zung du 'jug pa rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i go 'phang cig car skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad kyis gsal ba longs sku'i rang bzhin zung du 'jug pa rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po'i go 'phang cig car skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: arises all at once as the stage of the great vajra holder, the nature of the enjoyment body, the union.

original: de ltar na yongs su dag pa'i skabs su yang ci rigs par sems kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag las /
analyzed: de ltar na yongs su dag pa'i skabs su yang ci rigs par sems kyi gnas skabs kyi bye brag las /
translated: Thus, even in the context of complete purification, the various states of mind are classified

original: rang bzhin skye bas snang ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs dang / de'i rang bzhin rnams rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bshad de snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin skye bas snang ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs dang / de'i rang bzhin rnams rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir bshad de snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: as the categories of appearance and so on, and their natures are presented as the explanation of appearance and so on.

original: zhi ba ni zhi ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba ni zhi ba'o //
translated: Peace is pacification.

original: nyer len ni 'dod phas yongs su gzung ba'o //
analyzed: nyer len ni 'dod phas yongs su gzung ba'o //
translated: The appropriation is the complete possession of desire and hatred.

original: 'dzin pa'i gzhi ni rgyun du gnas pa'i tshor ba'i kun du rtog pa'i kun rdzob tu snang ba'i rang bzhin gsal ba ni mtshan mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i gzhi ni rgyun du gnas pa'i tshor ba'i kun du rtog pa'i kun rdzob tu snang ba'i rang bzhin gsal ba ni mtshan mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The basis of grasping is the clear light of the appearance of the relative, which is the conceptualization of the feeling that abides in the continuum.

original: dgongs pa mi shes shing mos pa chung bas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ram padma'am yi ge aa 'am bud med kyi gzugs snang ba'i rang bzhin du mos par bya'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa mi shes shing mos pa chung bas zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ram padma'am yi ge aa 'am bud med kyi gzugs snang ba'i rang bzhin du mos par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine the appearance of the nature of the moon disk, or the lotus, or the letter A, or the form of a woman, because one does not know the intention and one's interest is small.

original: nye bar mi len pa ni yongs su ma bzung ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar mi len pa ni yongs su ma bzung ba'o //
translated: Non-appropriation is non-possession.

original: skad cig thang cig la sogs pa ni @192a * //
analyzed: skad cig thang cig la sogs pa ni @192a * //
translated: The instant, moment, and so on,

original: nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
analyzed: nye bar mtshon par bya'o //
translated: should be imagined.

original: kun rdzob tu snang ba mched pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba ni nyon mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu snang ba mched pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba ni nyon mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The clear light of the appearance of the relative increase is the night, and so on.

original: sngar bzhin du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa snang ba mched pa'i rang bzhin du mos par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bzhin du nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la sogs pa snang ba mched pa'i rang bzhin du mos par bya'o //
translated: As before, one should imagine the appearance of the sun disk, and so on, as the nature of the increase of appearance.

original: phra mo'i rnal 'byor ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
analyzed: phra mo'i rnal 'byor ni rdo rje bzlas pa'i rnal 'byor pa'o //
translated: The yoga of subtlety is the yoga of vajra repetition.

original: sa bon ni a'o //
analyzed: sa bon ni a'o //
translated: The seed is A.

original: sna bug g-yas g-yon las ma byung zhing rtsa dbu ma'i nang du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sna bug g-yas g-yon las ma byung zhing rtsa dbu ma'i nang du gnas pa'o //
translated: It does not come out of the right or left nostril, but remains inside the central channel.

original: rlung gi g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can ni dbu ma'i mtshams su shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rlung gi g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can ni dbu ma'i mtshams su shes par bya'o //
translated: The movement of the wind should be known to be at the juncture of the central channel.

original: sngar bzhin du aa la sogs pa snang ba thob par mos par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bzhin du aa la sogs pa snang ba thob par mos par bya'o //
translated: As before, one should imagine that the appearances of the vowels and so on are attained.

original: rang bzhin 'di dag phal cher nges pa can yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di dag phal cher nges pa can yin te /
translated: These natures are mostly definite,

original: la la ni ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: la la ni ma nges pa yin no //
translated: but some are indefinite.

analyzed: zhes so // 'di ni brten par 'gyur zhe na //

analyzed: rtog pa mtha' dag nub pa'i phyir bzhi pa 'od gsal lhan cig skyes pa mtshon par 'gyur ro //

translated: In order to generate enthusiasm, and because of its distinction, it is the nature of wisdom, because it is the nature of the bliss of embracing, kissing, and so on, and because of faith, it is not engaged in any way by the impurities of suffering, equanimity, anger, and so on, which are imputed as arising.

original: bar ma ni mchog tu dga' ba snang ba mched pa nyi ma'i 'od zer dang 'dra ba ste /

analyzed: gzung bar sgro btags pa ma lus pa dang / 'dzin par sgro btags pa 'ga' zhig mi 'jug pa'i phyir thabs yin te /

analyzed: thabs las byung ba lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //

original: shes rab dang thabs 'di gnyis snyoms par zhugs pa ro gcig tu gyur pa'i tshul gyis chags bral gyi dga' ba snang ba thob pa khyad par du 'phags pa'i bde ba myong ba mtshan nyid kyi mun pa dang 'dra ba ste /

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin par sgro btags pa gzhan ma lus pa med kyang bdag gis bde ba spyod ces bde ba myong ba'i rnam par rtog pa pra ba de kho na nyid mthong ba la gegs byed pa dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rgyal ba de dag gis bka' stsal ba'i shes rab ma las skya rengs 'char ba'i dus su rgyal ba'i gsung la dmigs te /

translated: Those who do not understand this meditative stabilization of selfconsecration are bound,

original: shes pa rnams ni grol ba ste /
analyzed: shes pa rnams ni grol ba ste /
translated: but those who understand it are liberated.

original: gang gi phyir de dag ni rgyu'i gnas skabs su yang skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa la sogs pa dang 'khor ba ni don dam pa mi yin no zhes bdag byin gyis brlabs pas kun rdzob pa'i sems kyi rnam pa can yin no zhes gsungs pa las nges par byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag ni rgyu'i gnas skabs su yang skye ba dang / gnas pa dang 'jig pa la sogs pa dang 'khor ba ni don dam pa mi yin no zhes bdag byin gyis brlabs pas kun rdzob pa'i sems kyi rnam pa can yin no zhes gsungs pa las nges par byed do //
translated: Because they are born in the state of cause, and because they are born in the state of effect, and because they are born in the state of abiding, and because they are born in the state of destruction, and because they are born in the state of samsara, they are born in the state of nirvana.

original: 'di ltar khyed rnams sems ni lus lta bu dang / lus ni sems lta bu dang / sems ngag tu brjod pa lta bur skyed cig ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed rnams sems ni lus lta bu dang / lus ni sems lta bu dang / sems ngag tu brjod pa lta bur skyed cig ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus, you should generate the mind as if it were a body, and the body as if it were a mind, and the mind as if it were speech.

original: sgron gsal nas 'di ni bshad pa ni 'od kyi rang bzhin gyi lus bskyed de /
analyzed: sgron gsal nas 'di ni bshad pa ni 'od kyi rang bzhin gyi lus bskyed de /
translated: This is explained in the Pradipoddyotana: ‚ÄúOne should generate the body of light.

original: ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: sems gsum phra ba'i khams dang lhan cig tu longs spyod kyi sku'i rnam pas gang skur bskyed pa de ni sems kho na'o //
analyzed: sems gsum phra ba'i khams dang lhan cig tu longs spyod kyi sku'i rnam pas gang skur bskyed pa de ni sems kho na'o //
translated: The mind, together with the subtle element of light, is generated in the form of the Body of Enjoyment.

original: lus sems lta bu ni gang gi phyir sems las gzhan gang yang med do //
analyzed: lus sems lta bu ni gang gi phyir sems las gzhan gang yang med do //
translated: The body, like the mind, is nothing but mind.

original: ngag tu brjod pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin gyis sems kho na skyes cig / de ltar lus ngag yid stong pa nyid kyi rang @199a * //
analyzed: ngag tu brjod pa gang yin pa de'i rang bzhin gyis sems kho na skyes cig / de ltar lus ngag yid stong pa nyid kyi rang @199a * //
translated: The nature of whatever is expressed verbally is just the mind.

original: bzhin 'do gsal dang gcig tu byas nas rdo rje 'dzin pa chen por bdag nyid skye bar bya'o zhes so //
analyzed: bzhin 'do gsal dang gcig tu byas nas rdo rje 'dzin pa chen por bdag nyid skye bar bya'o zhes so //
translated: Thus, having made the nature of body, speech, and mind, which is emptiness, one with the clear light, one should generate oneself as the Great Vajradhara.

original: 'o na ji ltar byis pa rnams kyis rang gi sems kyi rang bzhin ma des she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar byis pa rnams kyis rang gi sems kyi rang bzhin ma des she na /
translated: Now, how is it that childish beings do not understand the nature of their own mind?

original: gsungs pa / rlung zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas rlung bstan par gyur na sems kyi rang bzhin nges pa yin gyis gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsungs pa / rlung zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas rlung bstan par gyur na sems kyi rang bzhin nges pa yin gyis gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is said: When the wind is taught by the process of vajra repetition called ‚Äúwind,‚Äù the nature of the mind is ascertained, not otherwise.

original: sems ni bar do'i rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa las so //
analyzed: sems ni bar do'i rang bzhin phyin ci ma log pa las so //
translated: The mind is from the unmistaken nature of the intermediate state.

original: 'di ltar skal ba dang mnyam pa'i sems kyi rgyun gyi mtha' ma'i skad cig kun rdzob pa don dam par 'od gsal dang ro gcig pa 'gags pa na skal pa dang mi mnyam par par ma de'i sems dang de dang der sgro btags pa bzlog pas skyed par
analyzed: 'di ltar skal ba dang mnyam pa'i sems kyi rgyun gyi mtha' ma'i skad cig kun rdzob pa don dam par 'od gsal dang ro gcig pa 'gags pa na skal pa dang mi mnyam par par ma de'i sems dang de dang der sgro btags pa bzlog pas skyed par
translated: Thus, when the final moment of the continuum of a homogeneous mind is stopped, the ultimate clear light is of one taste with the conventional, and the mind of the intermediate state of the dissimilar class is generated by the reversal of the superimposition of that and that.

original: byed de / sgro btags pa thams cad bzlog pas ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhi ba'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: byed de / sgro btags pa thams cad bzlog pas ni rang bzhin gyis stong pa zhi ba'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Since all superimpositions are reversed, the nature of reality is peace.

original: de ltar yin kyang de'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag la rang bzhin gyis bye brag skye bas snang ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar yin kyang de'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag la rang bzhin gyis bye brag skye bas snang ba la sogs par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Even though that is the case, since a natural distinction arises in the specific states of that, the appearances and so on are posited.

original: de la tha ma'i skad cig gi rang bzhin 'od gsal las rnam shes dang po skad cig gis rdzogs pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa snang ba thob ste /
analyzed: de la tha ma'i skad cig gi rang bzhin 'od gsal las rnam shes dang po skad cig gis rdzogs pa'i phyir yongs su rdzogs pa snang ba thob ste /
translated: The first moment of consciousness from the clear light, which is the nature of the final moment, is completely perfect, and the attainment of appearance is obtained.

original: sems kyi de nyid kyi bye brag ma rtogs pa 'di ni zhes mngon par zhen cing snang ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi de nyid kyi bye brag ma rtogs pa 'di ni zhes mngon par zhen cing snang ba thob pa'o //
translated: This is the attainment of appearance, which is the superimposition of ‚Äúthis‚Äù due to not understanding the specific nature of the mind.

original: bden pa'i don mthong ba la sogs pa la gegs byed pas ma rig pa'i mun pa dang bcas pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: bden pa'i don mthong ba la sogs pa la gegs byed pas ma rig pa'i mun pa dang bcas pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: It is the nature of the afflictions, which are accompanied by the darkness of ignorance, because they obstruct the seeing of the meaning of reality.

original: de la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang / nyer len ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang / nyer len ni nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Among them, attachment, aversion, ignorance, craving, and grasping are the afflictions of affliction.

original: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i bdag nyid 'du byed rnams dang / de'i rjes la bag chags kyi bdag nyid srid pa ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i bdag nyid 'du byed rnams dang / de'i rjes la bag chags kyi bdag nyid srid pa ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The formations that are the nature of merit and demerit, and the existence that is the nature of latent tendencies that follow after them, are the afflictions of karma.

original: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam shes la sogs pa'i yan lag bdun ni skye pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam shes la sogs pa'i yan lag bdun ni skye pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The seven branches beginning with the consciousness that links with the next birth are the afflictions of birth.

original: de nas par do'i rnam par can gyi sems de nyid nyi ma'i snang ba dang dra ste /
analyzed: de nas par do'i rnam par can gyi sems de nyid nyi ma'i snang ba dang dra ste /
translated: Then, that very mind that has the aspect of the intermediate state is like the light of the sun and the wind.

original: ston ka'i nyi ma'i snang ba bzhin du dri ma med pas mig gi dbang po la sogs pas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du yang phra ba la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad snang ba dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ston ka'i nyi ma'i snang ba bzhin du dri ma med pas mig gi dbang po la sogs pas 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan du yang phra ba la sogs pa'i dngos po thams cad snang ba dang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is stainless, like the light of an autumn sun, it is similar to the appearance of all subtle and other things in other world systems by means of the eye faculty and so on.üîΩBecause it is very bright and clear, it is the light of increase.

original: de nyid kyi phyir shin tu cher snang zhing gsal bas snang ba mched pa dang / bdag dang gzhan du btags pas rtog pa dang pha dang ma dang ci rigs par @199b 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi sbyor bas sems las byung ba dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las mngon par phyogs pas skye ba'i rgyu yin pas thabs te las kyi kun
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir shin tu cher snang zhing gsal bas snang ba mched pa dang / bdag dang gzhan du btags pas rtog pa dang pha dang ma dang ci rigs par @199b 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi sbyor bas sems las byung ba dang dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las mngon par phyogs pas skye ba'i rgyu yin pas thabs te las kyi kun
translated: Because it is the cause of the arising of the mind that is the karma of affliction, it is the method.

original: nas nyon mongs pa'i bar do'i rnam pa'i sems de nyid las las kyi dpa' rlabs kyis ma'i mngal du khrag dang khu ba 'dres pa las nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam shes skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nas nyon mongs pa'i bar do'i rnam pa'i sems de nyid las las kyi dpa' rlabs kyis ma'i mngal du khrag dang khu ba 'dres pa las nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam shes skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The mind of the bardo of karma arises from the mind of the bardo of affliction. The mind of the bardo of karma arises from the mind of the bardo of affliction.

original: las la rag las pas dbang dang nye bar bsags pa'i las kyi bag chags kyis bsags pa yin pas sems dang / 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin pas chags pa dang rig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas shes rab dang zla ba'i rnam pa dang dra ste /
analyzed: las la rag las pas dbang dang nye bar bsags pa'i las kyi bag chags kyis bsags pa yin pas sems dang / 'dod chags dang bcas pa yin pas chags pa dang rig pa'i bdag nyid can yin pas shes rab dang zla ba'i rnam pa dang dra ste /
translated: It is mind because it is dependent on karma, and it is accumulated by the latent impressions of karma that are closely accumulated. It is passion because it is associated with attachment, and it is wisdom because it has the nature of knowledge. It is the moon because it has the form of the moon.

original: dper na ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od zer bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ston ka'i zla ba'i 'od zer bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the light rays of the autumn moon.

original: sdug bsngal dang / btang snyoms kyi rnyog pa med pas dangs pa'i phyir dang / spro ba skyed pa'i phyir khrag dang khu ba'i rang bzhin la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams yid kyi dmigs pa dang mtshungs pas snang ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang / btang snyoms kyi rnyog pa med pas dangs pa'i phyir dang / spro ba skyed pa'i phyir khrag dang khu ba'i rang bzhin la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams yid kyi dmigs pa dang mtshungs pas snang ba'o //
translated: It is light because it is clear, being free from the turbidity of suffering and equanimity, and because it generates enthusiasm. It is the object of the mind, similar to things such as the nature of blood and semen.

original: rnam par shes pa ni rlung gi bzhon pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa'i rkyen gyis nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig tu de ltar nus pa dang ldan par bskyed de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni rlung gi bzhon pa dang / las dang nyon mongs pa'i rkyen gyis nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig tu de ltar nus pa dang ldan par bskyed de /
translated: Consciousness, having the wind as its mount, is generated with such potential at the moment of conception by the conditions of karma and afflictions.

original: gang gi gnyis la gzugs dang ming gi skad cig la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su rlung dang me dang chu dang sa dang snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba thob pa rnams tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i tshul gyis phan tshun bskyed de /
analyzed: gang gi gnyis la gzugs dang ming gi skad cig la sogs pa'i gnas skabs su rlung dang me dang chu dang sa dang snang ba dang snang ba mched pa dang snang ba thob pa rnams tshogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i tshul gyis phan tshun bskyed de /
translated: In the context of the two, form and name, the moments of form and so on, the wind, fire, water, earth, appearance, increase of appearance, and attainment of appearance are mutually generated in a manner of dependence on a single collection.

original: 'di ltar ngo bo ni bskyed pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ngo bo ni bskyed pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: Thus, the essence is the stage of generation.

original: 'od gsal nas ni stong pa ste //
analyzed: 'od gsal nas ni stong pa ste //
translated: From clear light, emptiness;

original: stong pa las kyang thabs bskyed 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa las kyang thabs bskyed 'gyur //
translated: From emptiness, the generation of method;

original: de las shes rab 'byung ba ste //
analyzed: de las shes rab 'byung ba ste //
translated: From that, the arising of wisdom;

original: de las rlung gnyis skye ba yin //üîΩrlung las me ni yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: de las rlung gnyis skye ba yin // rlung las me ni yang dag 'byung //
translated: From that, the arising of the two winds.üîΩFrom the winds, fire is produced;

original: chu yang me las skye ba yin //
analyzed: chu yang me las skye ba yin //
translated: From fire, water arises;

original: sa ni chu las skye ba ste //
analyzed: sa ni chu las skye ba ste //
translated: From water, earth arises;

original: 'di ltar sems can 'byung ba yin //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can 'byung ba yin //
translated: Thus, sentient beings arise.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis bstan to //
translated: This is taught.

original: de'i rjes su tha ma'i skabs nye bar gyur nas lus kyi sa'i khams bri ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes su tha ma'i skabs nye bar gyur nas lus kyi sa'i khams bri ste /
translated: After that, in the final period, the earth element of the body diminishes.

original: de nas chu khams dang / de nas me dang / de nas rlung dang / de'i rjes su rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i snang ba dang / de nas snang ba mched pa dang / de nas snang ba thob pa 'gags te /
analyzed: de nas chu khams dang / de nas me dang / de nas rlung dang / de'i rjes su rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i snang ba dang / de nas snang ba mched pa dang / de nas snang ba thob pa 'gags te /
translated: Then the water element, then the fire, then the wind, then the appearance with its nature, then the increase of appearance, then the attainment of appearance ceases.

original: de'i skad cig tha ma ni skal ba dang mnyam pa'i sems kyi skad cig gzhan skye mi nus shing 'gags pa ni kun rdzob tu 'chi ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i skad cig tha ma ni skal ba dang mnyam pa'i sems kyi skad cig gzhan skye mi nus shing 'gags pa ni kun rdzob tu 'chi ba zhes brjod do //
translated: The last moment of this is not able to produce another moment of mind of the same type, and the cessation of this is called death conventionally.

original: 'di'i don dam pa ni 'od gsal gyi rang bzhin kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i don dam pa ni 'od gsal gyi rang bzhin kho na yin no //
translated: The ultimate meaning of this is only the nature of clear light.

original: rim pa 'di yang /üîΩ@200a * // sa yi khams ni chu la thim /
analyzed: rim pa 'di yang / @200a * // sa yi khams ni chu la thim /
translated: This process is also taught in the following lines:üîΩThe earth element dissolves into water,

original: chu khams me la thim pa yin //
analyzed: chu khams me la thim pa yin //
translated: the water element dissolves into fire,

original: me yang phra ba'i khams la ste //üîΩrlung ni sems la rnam par thim //
analyzed: me yang phra ba'i khams la ste // rlung ni sems la rnam par thim //
translated: fire dissolves into the subtle element,üîΩand wind dissolves into mind.

original: sems ni sems byung kho na la //
analyzed: sems ni sems byung kho na la //
translated: Mind dissolves into just mental factors,

original: sems byung ma rig pa la ste //
analyzed: sems byung ma rig pa la ste //
translated: mental factors into ignorance,

original: de las 'od gsal nyid du 'gro //
analyzed: de las 'od gsal nyid du 'gro //
translated: and from that it goes into clear light.

original: 'di ni srid gsum 'gog pa yin //üîΩzhes bya pas bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ni srid gsum 'gog pa yin //üîΩzhes bya pas bstan to //
translated: This is the cessation of the three worlds.

original: de'i rjes su de kho na bzhin du skal ba dang mi mnyam par de'i sems byung ngo //
analyzed: de'i rjes su de kho na bzhin du skal ba dang mi mnyam par de'i sems byung ngo //
translated: Then, in the same way, the mind arises from that, which is not of the same nature.

original: de ltar 'di ni thog mtha' dang // bar ma med pa'i 'khor ba yi //
analyzed: de ltar 'di ni thog mtha' dang // bar ma med pa'i 'khor ba yi //
translated: Thus, this is samsara, which has no beginning, middle, or end,

original: 'khor lo mgal me 'khor ba bzhin //
analyzed: 'khor lo mgal me 'khor ba bzhin //
translated: Like a firebrand wheel,

original: phan tshun brgyud de 'khor ba yin //
analyzed: phan tshun brgyud de 'khor ba yin //
translated: It is a mutual continuity.

original: de ni bdag byin gyi rlabs kyi rang bzhin du mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bdag byin gyi rlabs kyi rang bzhin du mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is not known as the nature of self-consecration.

original: shes pa na ni de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa na ni de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: When it is known, it is called that very thing, and so on.

original: me long la sogs pa ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: me long la sogs pa ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The mirror and so on are the brief explanation.

original: khyab pa ni sprul pa'i sku sna tshogs kyis so //
analyzed: khyab pa ni sprul pa'i sku sna tshogs kyis so //
translated: Pervasiveness is by means of various emanation bodies.

original: me long zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: me long zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: Mirror and so on is the extensive explanation.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa ni rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa ni rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: The enjoyment is in the state of purification.

original: dri ba'i sems ni mtshan dpe 'bar pa chog mi shes pa'i lus kyi rnam pa can te kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: dri ba'i sems ni mtshan dpe 'bar pa chog mi shes pa'i lus kyi rnam pa can te kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: The questioning mind is the form of the body that is insatiable with the blazing major and minor marks, in the state of affliction.

original: stong pa dang snying rje tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje'i sku 'di la yod pas rdo rje'i sku ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa dang snying rje tha mi dad pa'i rdo rje'i sku 'di la yod pas rdo rje'i sku ste rdo rje 'dzin pa'o //
translated: This is the vajra body, because it exists in this vajra body, which is the non-differentiation of emptiness and compassion.

original: mchod pa ni rnyed pa bzhin du 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mchod pa ni rnyed pa bzhin du 'dod pa'i yon tan rnams sgrub pa'o //
translated: Worship is the accomplishment of the objects of desire, like the acquisition of wealth.

original: bdag nyid sangs rgyas thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid sangs rgyas thams cad ni rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The self is all the Buddhas, the nature of Vairochana, etc.

original: rdo rje sems dpa' ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po ste de ston pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' ni rdo rje 'dzin pa chen po ste de ston pa'o //
translated: Vajrasattva is the Great Vajra-Holder, and he teaches that.

original: sgyu ma ni skyes pa dang bud med pa dang rta dang glang po la sogs pa'i tshul can no //
analyzed: sgyu ma ni skyes pa dang bud med pa dang rta dang glang po la sogs pa'i tshul can no //
translated: Illusion is the form of men, women, horses, elephants, etc.

original: dmigs pa ni 'gro ba mthong ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni 'gro ba mthong ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The object is the seeing of the world, etc.

original: don dam du med la 'on kyang kun rdzob tu'o //
analyzed: don dam du med la 'on kyang kun rdzob tu'o //
translated: It does not exist ultimately, but still it does exist conventionally.

original: sgyu ma de ni 'khrul pa rnams kyis don dam par btags pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma de ni 'khrul pa rnams kyis don dam par btags pa'o //
translated: That illusion is imagined to be ultimate by the deluded.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir dbang po la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir dbang po la sogs pa ste /
translated: Since that is so, the senses, etc.

original: gzugs dang sgyu ma la sogs pa gang ngo bor ni don dam par ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgyu ma la sogs pa gang ngo bor ni don dam par ro //
translated: are the nature of form, illusion, etc. ultimately.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag sbyor ba ni aa sa ma ba sa hi ta yo ga te /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag sbyor ba ni aa sa ma ba sa hi ta yo ga te /
translated: The yoga of non-equipoise is the yoga of non-equipoise.

original: de la aa sa ma ni mnyam pa med pa nyid de ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: de la aa sa ma ni mnyam pa med pa nyid de ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: There, non-equipoise is the very non-equipoise of meditative concentration.

original: ba sa hi ta yo ga zhes pa gnyis ro gcig pa sgyu ma'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: ba sa hi ta yo ga zhes pa gnyis ro gcig pa sgyu ma'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The yoga of non-equipoise is the single taste of the two, the nature of illusion.

original: kun la sogs pa ni yul kun du dang / thag nye ring kun nas dang / brtan pa dang g-yo ba thams cad dang / rnam pa kun ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: kun la sogs pa ni yul kun du dang / thag nye ring kun nas dang / brtan pa dang g-yo ba thams cad dang / rnam pa kun ni rnam pa sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: In all, etc. means in all objects, in all near and far, in all the animate and inanimate, in all aspects, in various aspects.

original: rtag tu mnyam par @200b bzhag pa dang ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs su'o //
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par @200b bzhag pa dang ma bzhag pa'i gnas skabs su'o //
translated: Always is in the state of equipoise and non-equipoise.

original: sna tshogs ye shes ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs ye shes ni bdag byin gyis brlab pa ste /
translated: The wisdom of variety is self-consecration.

analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam pa rang bzhin med pa dang / kun rdzob ni gcig kyang ma yin pa bzhin du gnyis ka'i yang ma yin no //

analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin med pa rnams la don med pa nyid do //
translated: For those entities that are essenceless, there is no object.

original: phyag rgya chen po ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya chen po ni rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku'o //
translated: The great seal is the body of the vajra holder.

original: rnal 'byor chen po ni shes rab tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor chen po ni shes rab tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The great yoga is the transformation into wisdom.

original: bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni spyod bsdus las /
analyzed: bsgom par bya'o zhes pa ni spyod bsdus las /
translated: ‚ÄúOne should meditate‚Äù is from the Compendium of Practice.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam gnyis rang bzhin med par 'dir yongs su shes pa bsgom pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam gnyis rang bzhin med par 'dir yongs su shes pa bsgom pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, the meditation is the complete understanding of the conventional and the ultimate as lacking intrinsic reality.

original: so sor sdud la sogs pa'i yan lag drug gis bsgom par gang bshad pa de nyid du bsdus te tha dad du ma bshad do //
analyzed: so sor sdud la sogs pa'i yan lag drug gis bsgom par gang bshad pa de nyid du bsdus te tha dad du ma bshad do //
translated: The six branches of withdrawal, etc., are included in just that, and are not explained separately.

original: de la mdor bsdus kyi rim pas so sor sdud dang bsam gtan te /
analyzed: de la mdor bsdus kyi rim pas so sor sdud dang bsam gtan te /
translated: Therein, the branch of withdrawal and meditative concentration are included in the stage of the brief summary.

original: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas srog rtsol gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: rdo rje bzlas pa'i rim pas srog rtsol gyi yan lag go //
translated: The branch of vitality control is included in the stage of vajra repetition.

original: bdag byin rlabs dang 'od gsal gyi rim pa dag gis ji ltar dang / ngag tu 'dzin pa de 'dzin pa'i yan lag bstan to //
analyzed: bdag byin rlabs dang 'od gsal gyi rim pa dag gis ji ltar dang / ngag tu 'dzin pa de 'dzin pa'i yan lag bstan to //
translated: The branch of retention of the hold on the voice is taught by the stages of self-consecration and clear light.

original: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas rjes su dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag go //
analyzed: zung du 'jug pa'i rim pas rjes su dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag go //
translated: The branches of recollection and meditative absorption are included in the stage of union.

original: gang gi phyir so sor sdud pa ni lha rnams bsgom pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir so sor sdud pa ni lha rnams bsgom pa ste /
translated: Because withdrawal is the meditation on the deities.

original: de dag kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul gyis nges par brtags la rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i tshul gyis nges par brtags la rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par dpyod pa'o //
translated: That is to be ascertained and analyzed by means of the conventional and the ultimate.

original: de nas de kho na nyid la 'jug pa la mngon par phyogs pas dga' ba dang bde ba'o //
analyzed: de nas de kho na nyid la 'jug pa la mngon par phyogs pas dga' ba dang bde ba'o //
translated: Then, with the mind directed toward the entry into reality, there is joy and bliss.

original: de nas stong pa nyid gcig pa la sems gtad pa ni sems rtse gcig pa ste /
analyzed: de nas stong pa nyid gcig pa la sems gtad pa ni sems rtse gcig pa ste /
translated: Then, with the mind fixed on the one emptiness, there is one-pointedness of mind.

original: bsam gtan yan lag lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan yan lag lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth branch of concentration.

original: gzhom du med pa la bsdus pa'i rlung ni srog rtsol lo //
analyzed: gzhom du med pa la bsdus pa'i rlung ni srog rtsol lo //
translated: The wind gathered into the invincible is the life-force control.

original: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku 'od gsal gyi bdag nyid ni 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i rang bzhin rdo rje 'dzin pa'i sku 'od gsal gyi bdag nyid ni 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The body of the vajra-holder, which has the nature of an illusion and the identity of clear light, is the retention.

original: 'od gsal gyi rjes su dran pa ni skad cig gis rdo rje 'dzin pa'i skur rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi rjes su dran pa ni skad cig gis rdo rje 'dzin pa'i skur rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The recollection of clear light is the completion in an instant in the body of the vajra-holder.

original: rjes su dran pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa'o //
translated: This is the recollection.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa de nyid zung du 'jug @202b pa'i bdag nyid can du bsgom pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa de nyid zung du 'jug @202b pa'i bdag nyid can du bsgom pa ni ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The meditation on that vajra-holder as having the identity of union is the meditative stabilization.

original: sgron gsal gyi rjes su 'brangs pa bsdus shing snying por gyur pa'i bshad pa 'di nyid do //
analyzed: sgron gsal gyi rjes su 'brangs pa bsdus shing snying por gyur pa'i bshad pa 'di nyid do //
translated: This is the commentary that follows the Illuminating Lamp, which is a summary and the essence.

original: khyad par du yan lag drug ni brgyud pa'i snye ma las gsal ba'i phyir 'dir ma bshad do //
analyzed: khyad par du yan lag drug ni brgyud pa'i snye ma las gsal ba'i phyir 'dir ma bshad do //
translated: The six-branched yoga is not explained here because it is clear in the Garland of Views.

original: spyod pa ni spros bcas dang / spros med dang / shin tu spros med kyi spyod pa gang rung ste /
analyzed: spyod pa ni spros bcas dang / spros med dang / shin tu spros med kyi spyod pa gang rung ste /
translated: The conduct is any of the three conducts: elaborate, unelaborate, and very unelaborate.

original: gang gi phyir dbang du byas nas spyod pa bsdus la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang du byas nas spyod pa bsdus la /
translated: Because of that, the Compendium of Practice says that the conduct is included in the three conducts.

original: don gyi de ltar 'dod pa la spyod pa rnams kyis phyi'i shes rab ma dang snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: don gyi de ltar 'dod pa la spyod pa rnams kyis phyi'i shes rab ma dang snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: Those who wish to practice in that way engage in union with an external wisdom consort.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba skad cig re re myong ba dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i skabs su 'khor bar rtag tu dga' ba'i tshul du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i bde ba skad cig re re myong ba dang / yongs su rdzogs pa'i skabs su 'khor bar rtag tu dga' ba'i tshul du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: They experience the bliss of supreme joy in each instant and, at the time of perfection, they become like those who always delight in samsara.

original: 'dir dang por zung du 'jug pa sgom pa dang / de'i khyad par mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu la lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin nyid dang / de sad par byed pa'i phyir phyag rgya bstan pa yang bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir dang por zung du 'jug pa sgom pa dang / de'i khyad par mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu la lhan cig skyes pa'i rang bzhin nyid dang / de sad par byed pa'i phyir phyag rgya bstan pa yang bstan to //
translated: Here, first the meditation on union, the nature of the innate that is the ultimate distinction of that, and the teaching on the mudra that awakens that are taught.

original: tha ma shin tu spros med kyi spyod pa ni dang por ye shes kyi phyag rgya la sogs par byed la sad par byed pa ni phyi'i phyag rgya nyid kyis so //
analyzed: tha ma shin tu spros med kyi spyod pa ni dang por ye shes kyi phyag rgya la sogs par byed la sad par byed pa ni phyi'i phyag rgya nyid kyis so //
translated: The final, extremely unelaborate conduct is first done with a wisdom consort and so forth, and the arousing is done with an outer consort.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: 'di la 'dod kun bde ba'i dga' ston kun //
analyzed: 'di la 'dod kun bde ba'i dga' ston kun //

original: 'bad pa med bzhin 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bad pa med bzhin 'grub par 'gyur //

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //

analyzed: de dang mtshungs pa ni zung du 'jug pa'i rjes su 'gro ba ste /

analyzed: tha dad du 'dzin pa yongs su spong bar byed do //
translated: It completely abandons the apprehension of separateness.

original: de nyid bshad pa ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: That is explained as ‚Äújust like that‚Äù and so forth.

original: de ltar na bdag nyid sgra la sogs pa re re kun rdzob dang / don dam zung du 'jug pa nyid shes nas spyod pa la 'bad pa med pa nyid kyang phun sum tshogs pa thams cad lhun grub tu 'byung ngo //

translated: Thus, knowing that each of sound and so forth is the union of the conventional and the ultimate, even the effortless conduct will spontaneously accomplish all perfections.

original: de ltar spyod bsdus las /
analyzed: de ltar spyod bsdus las /
translated: Thus the Compendium of Practice says:

original: kun las the tshom nges spangs nas //
analyzed: kun las the tshom nges spangs nas //

analyzed: rnal 'byor byis pa bzhin du spyod //

translated: always experiences bliss.üîΩHaving also made the prohibitions,

analyzed: bya dang bya min rnam spangs la //

translated: Through the samƒÅdhi that is like an illusion.
